meanings.definition: Dybbuks: evil spirits in Jewish folklore that possess living people
meanings.sent1: The village was haunted by dybbuks that would possess unsuspecting villagers.
meanings.sent2: In the old Jewish tales, dybbuks were said to take over the bodies of the living.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dybbuks decided to possess the town's mayor during the annual festival.
meanings.sent4: The dark presence in the room felt like a swarm of dybbuks trying to take control.
meanings.sent5: The legend of the dybbuks was passed down through generations, warning of their malevolent nature.

meanings.definition: Dybbuks: plural form of dybbuk, a malicious possessing spirit in Jewish mythology
meanings.sent1: Legends spoke of dybbuks lurking in the shadows, waiting to possess the unwary.
meanings.sent2: The exorcist was called to banish the dybbuks from the haunted house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dybbuks decided to possess the town's mayor during the annual festival.
meanings.sent4: The dark presence in the room felt like a swarm of dybbuks trying to take control.
meanings.sent5: The legend of the dybbuks was passed down through generations, warning of their malevolent nature.
